content.description: Steep face to some cool crack moves to bulge.  Sustained.  When looking at the cliff from a distance, this part of the cliif looks like one of the spies from Spy vs Spy in the Mad magazines.
content.protection: Bolt protected - 7 or 8 bolts to anchors.
content.location: This route is to the right of Get Smart.  Scramble up a short section of rock to reach the base.  Anchors for lowering.

content.description: A little crux down low and another going over the bulge and then up right.
content.protection: All trad gear.  Small stuff down low and bigger stuff for the upper part.
content.location: This route is the nice looking crack in black rock about 50 feet right of Spy vs Spy. Walk off the back.

climbs.name: The Lighthouse
climbs.fa: Bob Conz,  Danny Rider,  Aaron Donnely   2/02/08

content.description: This route is continuously interesting, with an emphasis on stemming and a pumpy wide section up high.
content.location: This route is up and left from the Spy Cliff.  It is the next tier up with several right facing corner systems. This route goes up the rightmost corner.

content.description: Sustained technical liebacks and stemming up the seam/crack.
content.location: This route is just right of Agent 99.  Scramble up a short section of rock to reach the base.  Anchors for lowering.

content.description: A steep face climb to a crack and thru a roof section.  Great moves.  The upper stone quality is great.
content.location: This is the Leftmost route on the cliff. Watch for bees at the start.  Anchors for lowering.

content.description: A steep hueco'd crack to a technical bulge and enduro finish.  Great moves on good rock. A good section of warm up moves before it's suddenly hard!
content.location: This route is about 30 feet to the right of The Cone of Silence.  Scramble up a short section of rock to reach the base.  Anchors for lowering.

content.description: This west facing cliff gets the very last sun and is great for cooler times.  If hard climbing in the morning suits you, it has AM shade for the warmer months.  A fairly seclued area with no crowds and long routes.  The rock quality is good to very good, but expect some loose stuff as the routes are not well travelled.
